solution.text:
Given that :
Numbers of Red balls = _{i}_
Let R be the event 'drawing a red ball'
So, P(R) is the probability of drawing red ball
and
Let B be the event 'drawing a blue ball'
So, P(B) is the probability of drawing blue ball
Now,
According to the question, we know :
i.e., P(R) = _{j}_P(B)------eq.(1)
Also, we know that the sum of the probability of all cases is equal to one
i.e., P(R) + P(B) = 1-----eq.(2)
Solving eq.(1) and eq(2)
i.e., _{j}_P(B) + P(B) = 1
take P(B) common,
i.e., P(B)(_{j}_+1) = 1
i.e., P(B)_{{j+1}}_ = 1
i.e., P(B) = \(1\over _{{j+1}}_\)
i.e., P(B) = _{{trunc(1/(Decimal(j)+1),5)}}_ ---- eq.(3)
Now,
Let assume there are x number of blue balls in the bag
Then, the probability of drawing blue ball is:
P(B) = \(x\over x+_{i}_\) ------eq.(4)
Equating values of P(B) from eq.(3) & eq.(4)
we get : \(x\over x+_{i}_\) = _{{trunc(1/(Decimal(j)+1),5)}}_
Solving above equation :
x = \(_{{trunc(1/(Decimal(j)+1),5)}}_*_{i}_\over (1-_{{trunc(1/(Decimal(j)+1),5)}}_)\)
x = _{{trunc(((1/(Decimal(j)+1))*i)/(1-(1/(Decimal(j)+1))),5)}}_

content.text: A bag contains _{i}_ red ball and some blue balls.It is given that probability of drawing red ball is _{j}_ times that of a blue ball.Find the number of blue balls
